instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWDGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWDGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS_PWDGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Fan spins, stops then starts but board won't boot
threads.message:
Originally the board was dead which i isolated to the smc. Once replaced, the fan would spin for like 12 seconds, stop and then start spinning and stays spinning but no board activity, no usb activity either. I did noticed the bluetooth module was getting very hot so removed it but the board still doesn't boot up. I

<SIGNAL>INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> - 3.0v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWDGD</SIGNAL> - 3.3
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> - 1.8v

Any suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Fan spins, stops then starts but board won't boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes on?
Did you try known good BIOS file?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Fan spins, stops then starts but board won't boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3
And yes, put good bios on with same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Fan spins, stops then starts but board won't boot
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>.
Do you get all voltages from page 11?
Must also check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
<TRANSISTOR>Q5150</TRANSISTOR> and its adjacent resistors is other point of interest.

Heat PCH/CPU for test as last resource.
